fields.summary: hypervisor not being populated in describe instances/images

status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
h3. The setup and the failure

When running an Ansible playbook which uses the ec2_ami module to create an image from an EBS-backed instance, the play will fail if the installed Ansible version is v2.1.0.

If the installed Ansible version is v2.0.1.0 and run against the very same playbook, the play will succeed.

Peeling back the layers, it appears that support for the {{CreationDate}} image attribute was added in Ansible v2.1.

Example playbook (tested on Euca v4.3.0 on CentOS 7.2):

{noformat}
[root@odc-c-12 ~]# cat test.yml
---
# build_image.yml

 - hosts: localhost
   connection: local
   gather_facts: False
   vars:
      rhel_version: 6
      ec2_url: http://compute.fest430.jimc.cs.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
      instance_id: i-ec7dd5f5
      emi_name: testfoobar
      emi_desc: testfoobar
   tasks:
    - name: Register EMI
      ec2_ami:
         aws_access_key: AKIAAWE3F3GIPEBXOK3H
         aws_secret_key: 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
         ec2_url: '{{ ec2_url }}'
         instance_id: '{{ instance_id }}'
         name: '{{ emi_name }}'
         description: '{{ emi_desc }}'
         wait: yes
         state: present
      register: emi
{noformat}

Example of failed play:

{noformat}
[root@odc-c-12 ~]# ansible-playbook test.yml
 [WARNING]: provided hosts list is empty, only localhost is available


PLAY [localhost] ***************************************************************

TASK [Register EMI] ************************************************************
An exception occurred during task execution. To see the full traceback, use -vvv. The error was: AttributeError: 'Image' object has no attribute 'creationDate'
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "module_stderr": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_xURin1/ansible_module_ec2_ami.py\", line 560, in <module>\n    main()\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_xURin1/ansible_module_ec2_ami.py\", line 552, in main\n    create_image(module, ec2)\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_xURin1/ansible_module_ec2_ami.py\", line 419, in create_image\n    module.exit_json(msg=\"AMI creation operation complete\", changed=True, **get_ami_info(img))\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_xURin1/ansible_module_ec2_ami.py\", line 332, in get_ami_info\n    creationDate=image.creationDate,\nAttributeError: 'Image' object has no attribute 'creationDate'\n", "module_stdout": "", "msg": "MODULE FAILURE", "parsed": false}

NO MORE HOSTS LEFT *************************************************************
        to retry, use: --limit @test.retry

PLAY RECAP *********************************************************************
localhost                  : ok=0    changed=0    unreachable=0    failed=1
{noformat}

It's worth noting that, despite the above failure, the image does get created.

For example:

{noformat}
IMAGE   emi-37698405    000579949057/testfoobar 000579949057    available       private x86_64  machine                         ebs     hvm
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING      EBS     /dev/sda        snap-20ae4c67   3       true    standard
{noformat}

h3. Where the issue manifests itself

If we examine the relevant Ansible module code in this file:

{{/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ansible/modules/core/cloud/amazon/ec2_ami_find.py}}

we see this comment on line 86:

{noformat}
      - Starting at version 2.1, additional sort choices of architecture, block_device_mapping, creationDate, hypervisor, is_public, location, owner_id, platform, root_device_name, root_device_type, state, and virtualization_type are supported.
{noformat}

and when we review lines 195-199, there's this helpful block:

{noformat}
creationDate:
    description: creation date of image
    returned: when AMI found
    type: string
    sample: "2015-10-15T22:43:44.000Z"
{noformat}

There are a few more references to {{creationDate}} in the code which I won't copy/paste here.

For additional reference, this attribute would appear to be supported in AWS, as shown in the {{aws ec2 describe-images help}} man page:

{noformat}
--[snip]--
              CreationDate -> (string)
                 The date and time the image was created.
--[snip]--
{noformat}

Also here: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/ec2/describe-images.html

Finally, here's Ansible's ec2_ami module reference page: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/ec2_ami_module.html

Based on the above, this would appear to be a feature in AWS EC2 image management which does not presently exist in Eucalyptus.
fields.summary: Ansible v2.1 ec2_ami module image creation fails due to no image attribute "CreationDate"

comments.body:
We should update the DescribeImages response to include the creation date for applicable binding versions.

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeImages.html
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_Image.html

The creation date is now included in responses when describing images:

{code}
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2015-10-01/">
  <requestId>4a04a43e-a559-459a-9588-61fc3a11de72</requestId>
  <imagesSet>
    <item>
      <imageId>emi-519b32c0</imageId>
      <imageLocation>eucalyptus-service-image-v3.8/eucalyptus-service-image.raw.manifest.xml</imageLocation>
      <imageState>available</imageState>
      <imageOwnerId>000733437348</imageOwnerId>
      <isPublic>false</isPublic>
      <productCodes/>
      <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
      <imageType>machine</imageType>
      <platform/>
      <name>eucalyptus-service-image-v3.8</name>
      <rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType>
      <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda</rootDeviceName>
      <blockDeviceMapping/>
      <virtualizationType>hvm</virtualizationType>
      <tagSet>
        <item>
          <key>provides</key>
          <value>imaging,loadbalancing</value>
        </item>
        <item>
          <key>type</key>
          <value>eucalyptus-service-image</value>
        </item>
        <item>
          <key>version</key>
          <value>3.8</value>
        </item>
      </tagSet>
      <creationDate>2016-10-13T23:34:20.280Z</creationDate>
    </item>
    <item>
      <imageId>emi-7f6427f0</imageId>
      <imageLocation>cirros-2014-06-17/cirrosraw.img.manifest.xml</imageLocation>
      <imageState>available</imageState>
      <imageOwnerId>000733437348</imageOwnerId>
      <isPublic>false</isPublic>
      <productCodes/>
      <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
      <imageType>machine</imageType>
      <platform/>
      <name>cirros-2014-06-17</name>
      <rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType>
      <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda</rootDeviceName>
      <blockDeviceMapping/>
      <virtualizationType>hvm</virtualizationType>
      <tagSet/>
      <creationDate>2016-10-14T04:50:40.220Z</creationDate>
    </item>
  </imagesSet>
</DescribeImagesResponse>
{code}

Fix Verified

eucalyptus-4.4.0-0.25812.163.20170303gitb711a30.el7.x86_64

Creation date included in describe images response
{code}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2015-10-01/">
   <requestId>28fa83e0-c745-4388-833a-ccaf0427e1cc</requestId>
   <imagesSet>
      <item>
         <imageId>emi-7a56d174</imageId>
         <imageLocation>000079569021/bfebs_snap-7711e4e2</imageLocation>
         <imageState>available</imageState>
         <imageOwnerId>000079569021</imageOwnerId>
         <isPublic>true</isPublic>
         <productCodes />
         <architecture>i386</architecture>
         <imageType>machine</imageType>
         <platform />
         <name>bfebs_snap-7711e4e2</name>
         <description>bfebs</description>
         <rootDeviceType>ebs</rootDeviceType>
         <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda</rootDeviceName>
         <blockDeviceMapping>
            <item>
               <deviceName>/dev/sda</deviceName>
               <ebs>
                  <snapshotId>snap-7711e4e2</snapshotId>
                  <volumeSize>3</volumeSize>
                  <deleteOnTermination>true</deleteOnTermination>
                  <volumeType>standard</volumeType>
               </ebs>
            </item>
         </blockDeviceMapping>
         <virtualizationType>hvm</virtualizationType>
         <tagSet />
         <creationDate>2017-03-03T21:37:16.529Z</creationDate>
      </item>
      <item>
         <imageId>emi-328e2716</imageId>
         <imageLocation>000079569021/image-import-i-9d65051c</imageLocation>
         <imageState>available</imageState>
         <imageOwnerId>000079569021</imageOwnerId>
         <isPublic>true</isPublic>
         <productCodes />
         <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
         <imageType>machine</imageType>
         <platform>windows</platform>
         <name>image-import-i-9d65051c</name>
         <rootDeviceType>ebs</rootDeviceType>
         <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda</rootDeviceName>
         <blockDeviceMapping>
            <item>
               <deviceName>/dev/sda</deviceName>
               <ebs>
                  <snapshotId>snap-b65244ea</snapshotId>
                  <volumeSize>13</volumeSize>
                  <deleteOnTermination>false</deleteOnTermination>
                  <volumeType>standard</volumeType>
               </ebs>
            </item>
         </blockDeviceMapping>
         <virtualizationType>hvm</virtualizationType>
         <tagSet />
         <creationDate>2017-03-03T23:33:16.834Z</creationDate>
      </item>
      <item>
         <imageId>emi-e3d0f017</imageId>
         <imageLocation>testrunner-precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1img/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img.manifest.xml</imageLocation>
         <imageState>available</imageState>
         <imageOwnerId>000079569021</imageOwnerId>
         <isPublic>true</isPublic>
         <productCodes />
         <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
         <imageType>machine</imageType>
         <platform />
         <name>preciseservercloudimgamd64disk1img-1488576788X</name>
         <rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType>
         <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda</rootDeviceName>
         <blockDeviceMapping />
         <virtualizationType>hvm</virtualizationType>
         <tagSet />
         <creationDate>2017-03-03T21:33:09.082Z</creationDate>
      </item>
   </imagesSet>
</DescribeImagesResponse>
{code}
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
